posts.post_content:
Ignoring the hundreds of uses this has, it's a 3/1 flyer for 3, which isn't bad. In fact, if you bounce back one of your tapped lands, it's virtually a 3/1 for 2, which is great.  
  
Now, we can take a look at all the other things it can do.  
  
1. Freak out your opponent with its art  
2. Can shield your eyes from the glare of the sun.  
3. Can be turned into pulp, than recycled into a completely different piece of paper  
4. Tear it up and use it as confetti.  
5. Use it as a proxy for another card.  
6. Fling it to create a diversion so you can place down a [Cheatyface](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cheatyface).  
  
And it also has a readily abuseable ability that can reset planeswalkers, kill tokens, retrigger ETB effects, untap lands, remove blockers, destroy auras, unequip equipment, return creatures to your control, protect things from mass removal, and the list goes on.
posts.html:
Ignoring the hundreds of uses this has, it's a 3/1 flyer for 3, which isn't bad. In fact, if you bounce back one of your tapped lands, it's virtually a 3/1 for 2, which is great.

Now, we can take a look at all the other things it can do.

1. Freak out your opponent with its art
2. Can shield your eyes from the glare of the sun.
3. Can be turned into pulp, than recycled into a completely different piece of paper
4. Tear it up and use it as confetti.
5. Use it as a proxy for another card.
6. Fling it to create a diversion so you can place down a Cheatyface.

And it also has a readily abuseable ability that can reset planeswalkers, kill tokens, retrigger ETB effects, untap lands, remove blockers, destroy auras, unequip equipment, return creatures to your control, protect things from mass removal, and the list goes on.

posts.post_content: @ Guest1381794618: That's a good idea, but unfortunately, if you flicker the Wisp with Venser, it exiles something your opponent has for the entirety of their next turn because the Wisp is returned at the end of your turn, so you couldn't exile it permanently with the Sundial. You'd need something like [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop) instead. However, if you had [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift) instead of Venser...

posts.post_content:
True shame that it doesn't have flash, but a 3/1 for 3-cmc with flying is STILL a 3/1 with flying.  
  
Flickering cards in and out is nice, especially when you can target anything (without shroud/hexproof, obviously). You can flicker out a blocker, an enchantment that'll hurt you (eg. [Propaganda](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Propaganda)) or your own thing that will die soon (maybe it's going to vanish, or it's got a lot of -1/-1 counters on it. You know, all that Shadowmoor stuff...).  
  
As kiseki said, fickering can break cards so well.
posts.html:

Flickering cards in and out is nice, especially when you can target anything (without shroud/hexproof, obviously). You can flicker out a blocker, an enchantment that'll hurt you (eg. Propaganda) or your own thing that will die soon (maybe it's going to vanish, or it's got a lot of -1/-1 counters on it. You know, all that Shadowmoor stuff...).

As kiseki said, fickering can break cards so well.

posts.post_content:
This is my favorite white card of all time. People have already mentioned the efficiency and a few comparisons so I will get right to my favorite combos:  
  
Tokens! [Maul Splicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maul Splicer), [Cloudgoat Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudgoat Ranger), [Chancellor of the Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chancellor of the Forge)  
Resources! [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden), [Suture Priest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Suture Priest), [Elvish Visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Visionary), [Farhaven Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Farhaven Elf)  
Removal! [Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime), [Exclusion Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exclusion Ritual), [Sparkmage Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sparkmage Apprentice), [Furystoke Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furystoke Giant), [Flametongue Kavu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flametongue Kavu )   
Shenanigans! Flicker another Flickerwisp and then deprive your opponent of something then need next turn, use miraculous recovery to do these things instantly, remove a blocker, kill a token, force an additional bounce on a bounce land, get your permanents back, (re)move auras...  
  
The efficiency is insane. ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) for a 3/1 flier AND two 3/3 golems, or AND e... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This is my favorite white card of all time. People have already mentioned the efficiency and a few comparisons so I will get right to my favorite combos:

Tokens! Maul Splicer, Cloudgoat Ranger, Chancellor of the Forge
Resources! Soul Warden, Suture Priest, Elvish Visionary, Farhaven Elf
Removal! Acidic Slime, Exclusion Ritual, Sparkmage Apprentice, Furystoke Giant, Flametongue Kavu
Shenanigans! Flicker another Flickerwisp and then deprive your opponent of something then need next turn, use miraculous recovery to do these things instantly, remove a blocker, kill a token, force an additional bounce on a bounce land, get your permanents back, (re)move auras...

The efficiency is insane. for a 3/1 flier AND two 3/3 golems, or AND e... (see all)
